back_cards.definition_en: A person or group actively opposed to another.
back_cards.example_en: The two nations were enemies during the war.
Rust is the enemy of metal structures.

back_cards.definition_en: An opponent in a conflict or competition.
back_cards.example_en: The team faced their old enemy in the finals.
The soldiers prepared to meet the enemy.
Fear can be your worst enemy in life.

back_cards.definition_en: Physical harm that impairs value or function.
back_cards.example_en: The storm caused damage to the roof.

back_cards.definition_en: Loss or injury to reputation or finances.
back_cards.example_en: The scandal brought damage to her career.
They assessed the damage after the flood.
Smoking can cause damage to your lungs.
The insurance covered the damage repairs.

back_cards.definition_en: The state or fact of existing.
back_cards.example_en: Her being here made everyone happy.
The forest is home to many beings.

back_cards.definition_en: The essence or nature of something.
back_cards.example_en: Love is central to her being.
Every being deserves respect and kindness.
The book explores the meaning of being.

back_cards.definition_en: A violent weather event with wind and rain.
back_cards.example_en: The storm knocked out power in the town.
The news caused a storm of controversy.
The troops launched a storm on the fortress.
She weathered a storm of personal challenges.

back_cards.definition_en: A surge of activity or energy.
back_cards.example_en: A storm of applause followed her speech.

back_cards.definition_en: The external form or outline of something.
back_cards.example_en: The cloud had the shape of a heart.

back_cards.definition_en: The condition or state of something.
back_cards.example_en: Her fitness routine kept her in great shape.
The project is taking shape nicely.
The logo featured a star shape.

back_cards.definition_en: A mold or pattern for creating objects.
back_cards.example_en: The clay was pressed into a shape.

back_cards.definition_en: A round, deep dish for food or mixing.
back_cards.example_en: She served soup in a ceramic bowl.

back_cards.definition_en: A stadium or arena for sports events.
back_cards.example_en: The game will be at the Rose Bowl.

back_cards.definition_en: A game or competition, like bowling.
back_cards.example_en: They watched the Super Bowl together.

back_cards.definition_en: A rounded or hollow part of an object.
back_cards.example_en: The spoon’s bowl held the sugar.
He ate a bowl of cereal for breakfast.

back_cards.definition_en: A group authorized to perform specific duties.
back_cards.example_en: The commission investigated the accident.

back_cards.definition_en: A fee paid for services or sales.
back_cards.example_en: She earned a commission on each sale.

back_cards.definition_en: An order to create or undertake work.
back_cards.example_en: The artist received a commission for a mural.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of appointing to a role.
back_cards.example_en: His commission as an officer was celebrated.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal body with oversight powers.
back_cards.example_en: The election commission ensured fair voting.

back_cards.definition_en: The leader of a ship or aircraft.
back_cards.example_en: The captain navigated through the fog.

back_cards.definition_en: The head of a sports team.
back_cards.example_en: She was the captain of the soccer team.

back_cards.definition_en: A military officer of a specific rank.
back_cards.example_en: The captain led the platoon into battle.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in charge of a group.
back_cards.example_en: He acted as captain of the debate club.

back_cards.definition_en: A figure of authority or responsibility.
back_cards.example_en: The fire captain coordinated the rescue.
She whispered softly in his ear.
He has a good ear for melodies.

back_cards.definition_en: The part of a plant bearing seeds.
back_cards.example_en: The corn’s ear was ripe for harvest.
Her speech caught the ear of the audience.
The cup’s ear broke when it fell.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of soldiers or military personnel.
back_cards.example_en: The troop marched in perfect formation.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of people or animals.
back_cards.example_en: A troop of scouts camped in the woods.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit within a larger organization.
back_cards.example_en: The cavalry troop was ready for action.

back_cards.definition_en: A gathering for a shared purpose.
back_cards.example_en: The troop of volunteers cleaned the park.

back_cards.definition_en: A band or company of performers.
back_cards.example_en: The theater troop performed a comedy.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or animal of the female sex.
back_cards.example_en: The female led the herd to safety.

back_cards.definition_en: A woman or girl in a specific context.
back_cards.example_en: The female won the chess tournament.

back_cards.definition_en: The gender associated with certain traits.
back_cards.example_en: The survey included male and female responses.
The female bird built the nest.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for representation or identity.
back_cards.example_en: She was the only female in the boardroom.
The table was made of solid wood.
They hiked through the wood at dusk.
He gathered wood for the campfire.

back_cards.definition_en: A material used in construction or crafts.
back_cards.example_en: The wood was carved into a statue.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of wooden objects, like clubs.
back_cards.example_en: She chose a wood for her golf shot.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a moderate or pleasant heat.
back_cards.example_en: The warm sun felt good on her skin.
Her warm smile welcomed the guests.
The blanket kept her warm all night.

back_cards.definition_en: Close to a goal or answer.
back_cards.example_en: You’re getting warm in the guessing game.
The debate grew warm as opinions clashed.
The kitchen was clean after the party.
They drank clean water from the spring.
He ran a clean campaign for office.
The athlete made a clean jump.
Her desk was clean and organized.

back_cards.definition_en: To guide or direct a group.
back_cards.example_en: She will lead the team to victory.

back_cards.definition_en: To be in front or first place.
back_cards.example_en: He leads the race by ten meters.
The decision led to better results.

back_cards.definition_en: To show the way by example.
back_cards.example_en: They lead by demonstrating hard work.
She led the meeting with a question.

back_cards.definition_en: A government official heading a department.
back_cards.example_en: The minister of health announced new policies.

back_cards.definition_en: A religious leader or clergy member.
back_cards.example_en: The minister gave a sermon on Sunday.
The foreign minister met with allies.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who serves or assists.
back_cards.example_en: She acted as a minister to the poor.

back_cards.definition_en: A high-ranking official in a state.
back_cards.example_en: The prime minister appointed a new minister.
Her neighbor helped carry the groceries.
The neighbors gathered for a barbecue.

back_cards.definition_en: A country or place bordering another.
back_cards.example_en: Canada is a neighbor to the United States.

back_cards.definition_en: A fellow person in a shared space.
back_cards.example_en: He was a kind neighbor in the apartment.
She treated everyone like a neighbor.

back_cards.definition_en: Very small in size or amount.
back_cards.example_en: The tiny kitten fit in her hand.
A tiny crack appeared in the glass.
They lived in a tiny apartment downtown.
The change had a tiny effect on sales.
She wore a tiny necklace with a pearl.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the mind or intellect.
back_cards.example_en: She sought help for mental health issues.
The puzzle was a mental challenge.
Mental stress can affect physical health.

back_cards.definition_en: Done in the mind, not physically.
back_cards.example_en: He made a mental note to call later.
The hospital has a mental health ward.
She installed new software on her laptop.
The software updates improved performance.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of applications for tasks.
back_cards.example_en: The design software helped create the logo.
Developers wrote software for the app.
The company specializes in software solutions.
I’m glad you could join us today.
She was glad the exam was over.
His glad smile warmed the room.
We’re glad for your help with the project.
The glad atmosphere made the party fun.
The study’s finding confirmed the theory.
The finding of the artifact excited the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A result from research or inquiry.
back_cards.example_en: Her finding was published in a journal.
The report included a key finding on trends.

back_cards.definition_en: A verdict or decision in a case.
back_cards.example_en: The court’s finding favored the plaintiff.

back_cards.definition_en: A person with authority or power.
back_cards.example_en: The lord ruled over the medieval estate.

back_cards.definition_en: A title for nobility or high rank.
back_cards.example_en: The Lord of the manor hosted a feast.
They prayed to the Lord for guidance.

back_cards.definition_en: A term of respect or address.
back_cards.example_en: My lord, the council awaits your decision.
The lord granted land to his vassals.

back_cards.definition_en: To operate or control a vehicle.
back_cards.example_en: She learned to drive a car last summer.
The wind drove the boat toward shore.
Ambition drove him to start a business.

back_cards.definition_en: To carry out or pursue energetically.
back_cards.example_en: They drove the project to completion.

back_cards.definition_en: To travel by vehicle to a place.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s drive to the beach this weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: A measure of heat or coldness.
back_cards.example_en: The temperature dropped to 40 degrees.

back_cards.definition_en: The degree of warmth in a body.
back_cards.example_en: Her temperature was high due to fever.
The debate raised the temperature in the room.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific reading on a thermometer.
back_cards.example_en: The temperature outside is perfect for hiking.

back_cards.definition_en: A condition of climate or weather.
back_cards.example_en: Summer temperatures here are quite warm.
The quiet forest was peaceful at dawn.
She enjoyed a quiet evening at home.
He’s a quiet person but very thoughtful.
The dress had a quiet elegance.
The quiet town attracted retirees.

back_cards.definition_en: To extend or distribute over an area.
back_cards.example_en: She spread the blanket on the grass.
The news spread quickly through the town.

back_cards.definition_en: To apply or cover with something.
back_cards.example_en: He spread butter on his toast.

back_cards.definition_en: To expand or grow in scope.
back_cards.example_en: The wildfire spread to nearby hills.
They spread seeds across the field.
The bright sun shone in the sky.
She wore a bright red scarf.
The bright student solved the puzzle fast.
His bright smile lit up the room.
The future looks bright for the team.

back_cards.definition_en: To divide or separate with a sharp tool.
back_cards.example_en: She cut the paper with scissors.
The company cut costs to save money.

back_cards.definition_en: To trim or shape by slicing.
back_cards.example_en: He cut his hair for a new look.
The power was cut during the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: To edit or shorten, as in film.
back_cards.example_en: They cut the scene from the movie.

back_cards.definition_en: The power to affect decisions or actions.
back_cards.example_en: Her influence shaped the team’s strategy.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or thing with persuasive power.
back_cards.example_en: He was an influence on young artists.

back_cards.definition_en: The effect of one thing on another.
back_cards.example_en: The weather had an influence on crops.

back_cards.definition_en: Authority or sway in a context.
back_cards.example_en: She used her influence to secure funding.
Cultural influence is evident in the design.
He kicked the ball into the goal.
The event will kick off at noon.
She kicked the habit of smoking.
The horse kicked the gate open.

back_cards.definition_en: To experience a thrill or excitement.
back_cards.example_en: They kicked it up at the party.
The annual festival draws large crowds.
Her annual salary increased this year.
The company holds an annual meeting.
The plant is an annual, blooming once.
The annual report showed strong growth.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of steps to accomplish a task.
back_cards.example_en: The procedure for applying is simple.
The procedure took two hours to complete.

back_cards.definition_en: An established way of doing something.
back_cards.example_en: They followed safety procedures at work.
The procedure requires board approval.

back_cards.definition_en: A method or system for action.
back_cards.example_en: Her procedure for organizing was effective.

back_cards.definition_en: Admiration for someone’s qualities or achievements.
back_cards.example_en: She earned respect for her hard work.
He showed respect during the ceremony.
In that respect, the plan was flawless.
The leader commanded respect from all.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of value for something.
back_cards.example_en: Her respect for nature guided her choices.

back_cards.definition_en: A moving ridge on the surface of water.
back_cards.example_en: The wave crashed against the shore.

back_cards.definition_en: A gesture of the hand to signal.
back_cards.example_en: She gave a friendly wave to her neighbor.
A wave of excitement swept the crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: A pattern of energy, like sound or light.
back_cards.example_en: The radio wave transmitted the signal.

back_cards.definition_en: A period or trend of activity.
back_cards.example_en: The heat wave lasted for days.

back_cards.definition_en: A custom passed down through generations.
back_cards.example_en: The tradition of storytelling is ancient.

example_en: It’s a tradition to celebrate with family.
The festival is part of local tradition.

definition_en: A habitual way of doing something.
example_en: Her morning tea was a personal tradition.
The school upholds a tradition of excellence.

back_cards.definition_en: To express intent to harm or punish.
back_cards.example_en: He threatened to leave if ignored.

back_cards.definition_en: To pose a danger or risk to.
back_cards.example_en: The storm threatened to flood the town.
She threatened to call the police.
Dark clouds threatened rain all day.
They threatened him to stay silent.

back_cards.definition_en: First or most important in rank.
back_cards.example_en: Her primary goal was to graduate.
The primary colors are red, blue, and yellow.

back_cards.definition_en: Initial or earliest in a sequence.
back_cards.example_en: The primary stage of the project began.
He teaches at a primary school.

back_cards.definition_en: Serving as the main source or cause.
back_cards.example_en: The primary source of income was her job.
A strange noise came from the attic.
His strange habits surprised his friends.
The city felt strange to the new student.
It was strange to see snow in spring.
The strange silence made her uneasy.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who performs in plays or films.
back_cards.example_en: The actor starred in a new drama.

back_cards.definition_en: A participant in an action or process.
back_cards.example_en: She was a key actor in the negotiations.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional in theater or cinema.
back_cards.example_en: He trained to become a stage actor.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who plays a role or character.
back_cards.example_en: The actor portrayed a historical figure.

back_cards.definition_en: An individual involved in an event.
back_cards.example_en: The actor behind the decision stepped forward.
